articles.title: Antonio Conte admires Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola
articles.body: Chelsea head coach Antonio Conte admits he admires Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola who is a 'great coach'. City lead fifth-placed Chelsea, the Premier League holders, by 22 points ahead of Sunday's Sky Live clash at the Etihad Stadium. Conte expects City to build on their impressive second season under Guardiola, contrasting the situation with his own at Chelsea, where the Italian appears to be on the brink of a summer exit. 'I don't like people to envy the other person,' Conte said. 'I have great admiration because they found the right way to be strong for a long time, to have successful seasons for a long time, from now until I don't know.' Conte, who has rued Chelsea's transfer activity since last summer, insists City's success is not solely about finance. 'Manchester City is not the only club to spend a lot of money,' the Italian added. Conte is not looking beyond the immediate future, with the City clash followed by games with Crystal Palace, Barcelona and Leicester. 'The club, I think has the same ambition in this moment: to be focused on the present and not to look too far (ahead),' he said. 'For sure it's a moment very crucial for us. These two weeks are very important for us.'
articles.author: Matt Cheetham

articles.title: Alvaro Morata told how to break his Chelsea goal drought by Andriy Shevchenko
articles.body: Alvaro Morata needs to focus on his finishing if he is to end his Chelsea goal drought, according to Andriy Shevchenko. The Spain international enjoyed a prolific start to the season following his club-record £58million move from Real Madrid, but a niggling back injury allied to a loss of confidence has culminated in the 25-year-old going 10 games without a goal in all competitions. Milan legend Shevchenko endured an equally difficult period during his own Stamford Bridge career but believes Chelsea’s current No.9 can take heart from the fact he is getting on the end of chances but needs to be more composed in front of goal. ‘I’ve seen a lot of him,’ revealed Shevchenko, who was speaking in his role as a Laureus ambassador. ‘He’s had a lot of chances. I think you need to improve the finishing when you have chances. ‘It’s good when a striker has chances, it’s very positive. You need this for scoring goals and helping the team to win.’ Chelsea face runaway Premier League leaders Manchester City on Sunday, with Pep Guardiola’s side needing another five wins to become champions. Antonio Conte masterminded the Blues’ title-winning campaign last season but is expected to leave Stamford Bridge in the summer, although Shevchenko hopes the club keep hold of the Italian.
articles.author: John Secada

teams.name: Arsenal
teams.description: Arsenal Football Club is a professional football club based in Islington, London, England, that plays in the Premier League, the top flight of English football.

teams.description: Brighton & Hove Albion Football Club is a professional football club based in the city of Brighton and Hove, East Sussex, England

teams.name: Burnley F.C
teams.description: Burnley F.C. is a professional association football club based in Burnley, Lancashire, England. Founded in 1882, the club plays in the Premier League, the first tier of English football.

teams.name: Chelsea FC
teams.description: Chelsea Football Club is a professional football club in London, England, that competes in the Premier League. Founded in 1905, the club's home ground since then has been Stamford Bridge.

teams.name: Crystal Palace
teams.description: Crystal Palace Football Club is a professional football club based in Selhurst, London, that plays in the Premier League, the top tier of English football.

teams.name: Everton F.C
teams.description: Everton Football Club is a football club in Liverpool, England, that competes in the Premier League, the top flight of English football.

teams.name: Huddersfield Town A.F.C
teams.description: Huddersfield Town Association Football Club is a professional football club based in the town of Huddersfield, West Yorkshire, England.

teams.name: Leicester City F.C.
teams.description: Leicester City Football Club is an English professional football club based at the King Power Stadium in Leicester. They compete in the Premier League, England's top division of football.

teams.name: Liverpool FC
teams.description: Liverpool Football Club is a professional football club in Liverpool, England, which competes in the Premier League, the top tier of English football.

teams.name: Manchester City
teams.description: Manchester City Football Club is a professional football club based in , Greater Manchester, England, that competes in the Premier League, the top flight of English football.

teams.name: Manchester United
teams.description: Manchester United Football Club is a professional football club based in Old Trafford, Greater Manchester, England, that competes in the Premier League, the top flight of English football.

teams.name: Newcastle United F.C
teams.description: Newcastle United Football Club is an English professional association football club based in Newcastle upon Tyne, that currently plays in the Premier League, the top tier of English football.

teams.description: Tottenham Hotspur Football Club, commonly referred to simply as Tottenham or Spurs, is an English football club located in Tottenham, Haringey, London, that competes in the Premier League.

teams.description: Watford Football Club is a professional football club based in Watford, Hertfordshire, England, that plays in the Premier League, the highest level in the English football league system.

teams.description: West Bromwich Albion Football Club, also known as West Brom, The Baggies, The Throstles, Albion or simply WBA, is an English professional football club based in West Bromwich in the West Midlands

teams.name: West Ham United
teams.description: West Ham United Football Club is a professional football club based in Stratford, East London, England. They compete in the Premier League, the top tier of English football. The club re-located to the London Stadium in 2016.
